page.title: 13Facelift for Briars Hall
page.content: Briars Hall is an impressive landmark in our block. Situated on Briars Lane it was part of the Lathom estate,but in recent years has been used as a restaurant.However,at the start of 1985 it closed and since then has been completely refurbished. Cause Row Ltd.of Bootle undertook the work and it is due to open in August. The Hall is to re-open as a 12 bedroom hotel.There will also be a public bar. When we visited the site in June we asked Mr David McNamee,the prospective manager,more about the plans for the Hall.He said that one of the old barns adjacent to the Hall is going to be made into a type of steak house. The Hall will also cater for weddings and conferences.It will appear in a publication of 1986 called "The Guide to the Best Hotels in Great Britain." and hopes to be a 3 star hotel.
